posts.title: In-Tents
posts.content:
By now, you're probably familiar with Coler Mountain Bike Preserve, its beautiful trails, and the hip Airship Coffee location nestled on the grounds. It makes for a great day out in nature, but did you know you can actually camp there?

  • Not your average bathroom: Camping usually means roughing it, but at Coler, you get to enjoy the great outdoors without giving up some of your everyday creature comforts, like nice bathrooms.
  • Staycation: Camping in this beautiful spot is a great way to adventure right in your own backyard. You can not only enjoy a weekend in nature, but also enjoy all things downtown Bentonville.

If you're interested in learning more or booking a campsite, they start at $15 nightly, and you can book here.

posts.title: Taking Initiative
posts.content:
Project owners released plans yesterday for a new affordable housing project that will break ground in east Springdale mid 2022. 

  • For renters: The new Spring Creek Village will be for mixed-income and multi-family residents as a direct response to the high demand for affordable housing in Northwest Arkansas. It will be on 6.3 acres about 1 mile from The Jones Center. 
  • First steps: The project is a public-private partnership, possible due to City infrastructure contribution, Opportunity Zone tax incentives, and development funds. The hope is these resources will allow for the replication of this project across NWA. 

Read the full Talk Business & Politics story HERE.

posts.title: May The Market Continue
posts.content:
The Bentonville Farmers Market broke a record in sales this season, topping $1m! Though the weekly market in downtown is coming to an end, the Virtual Farmers Market is on its way. 

  • Shift: The final in-person market for the year is scheduled for this Saturday, Oct. 30, but a shift to an online option will allow you to purchase all the fresh, local foods and goods over the winter months, and year-round.
  • How it works: Customers can shop online, browse their favorite local vendors on their computer or smart phone through a mobile app. After checking out, customers can pick up their goods at 102 E. Central Ave. Thursdays from 4-6p. 

Access the Virtual Market HERE.

posts.title: Weekend Roundup
posts.content:
It's finally here - Halloween weekend - and SO much is going on. Here are a few of the fun things you could do over the weekend.

  • Rock: JJ's Live is having a Halloween themed night of "frighteningly good" 90s jams tomorrow.
  • Chili: Grab your jackets and start the holiday off right with Scare-o-tonin Sunday at Airship!
  • Classic: Stop by Downtown Springdale's Halloween Fest for candy, games, and more!
  • Day of the Dead: Switch it up and learn about a Mexican American holiday with the start of Dia de Muertos celebrations on Sunday.
  • Mural: Check out Crystal Bridges' pop-up experience at the last Bentonville Farmers Market Saturday.
  • Jam out: Live music is all over NWA this weekend. As always, you can't go wrong.
  • Cycle: Pedaler's Pub is claiming they have the proper way to celebrate Halloween...
  • Party: For those of you 21+, a haunted boogie bash will be at The Wishing Willow.
  • And more: Here are a couple more lists for you to make your weekend plans: 1 and 2.

Have so much fun, stay safe, see ya Monday!

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• More where that came from: Alice Walton will be overseeing additional 100,000 sq/ft of art galleries over the next year.
  • Tis the season: Here's your friendly reminder to watch out for deer on the roads.
  • Better planet: In the midst of the celebrations, another fall clean up is this weekend!
  • Shifting: The vaccine and negative test requirement at Theatre Squared expires Sunday.
